oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Andrew Jackson portrait
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Hand-colored patriotic engraving depicts bust image of General Andrew Jackson superimposed on U.S. flags, cannons, cannonballs, and an American eagle. Titled "Jackson/New Orleans Jany. 8th 1815."

Jackson commanded American forces at the Battle of New Orleans during the War of 1812. The battle had no effect on the war's outcome because word of the Treaty of Ghent (signed on December 24, 1814) had not yet reached America. Jackson came to national prominence was elected the 7th President of the United States. He served two terms (1829-1837).
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Jackson, Andrew, 1767-1845;Jackson, Andrew, 1767-1845. Works. 1986;Southern States--History--War of 1812
